moduleMetadataJson.name: Windows Manage RID Hijacking
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module will create an entry on the target by modifying some properties
        of an existing account. It will change the account attributes by setting a
        Relative Identifier (RID), which should be owned by one existing
        account on the destination machine.

        Taking advantage of some Windows Local Users Management integrity issues,
        this module will allow to authenticate with one known account
        credentials (like GUEST account), and access with the privileges of another
        existing account (like ADMINISTRATOR account), even if the spoofed account is
        disabled.
author: Sebastian Castro <sebastian.castro@cslcolombia.com>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: SESSION
options.description: The session to run this module on.

options.name: GETSYSTEM
options.description: Attempt to get SYSTEM privilege on the target host.

options.name: GUEST_ACCOUNT
options.description: Assign the defined RID to the Guest Account.

options.name: USERNAME
options.description: User to set the defined RID.

options.name: PASSWORD
options.description: Password to set to the defined user account.

options.name: RID
options.description: RID to set to the specified account.
